issue.title: [CF 1141] Timername syntax
issue.body:
^1^T^SType^Sconditionicon ^SConditionDurEnabled^B ^SBarDisplay_Invert^B ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SDBM_TIMER ^SOperator^S<= ^SLevel^N5 ^SName^SPounding ^t^N2^T ^SType^SDBM_TIMER ^SOperator^S<= ^SLevel^N5 ^SName^SGrasping~`Hands ^t^N3^T ^SType^SDBM_TIMER ^SOperator^S<= ^SLevel^N5 ^SName^STest~`Bar ^t^N4^T ^SType^SDBM_TIMER ^SOperator^S<= ^SLevel^N5 ^SName^SMannoroth's~`Gaze ^t^Sn^N4 ^t^SConditionDur^N5 ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sbar^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^STexts^T ^N1^S ^N2^S ^N4^S ^t^t^t^SCustomTex^S166062 ^SOnlyIfCounting^B ^SGUID^STMW:icon:1Lh4aKeHH0ku ^SFakeHidden^B ^SEnabled^B ^t^N73501^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

How do i return the timername of the boss timer condition ?


> Posted by CurseForge user Drozo_Qoocla | Imported from CurseForge issue #1141 | Raw

comments.body:
Return it to where?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

To the bar/icon.


> Posted by CurseForge user Drozo_Qoocla

You can't. Conditions don't report data to anything - it wouldn't make any sense for them to do so. What you're asking for would require a new icon type.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
